page.title: 11LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: This particular section of land cover is approximately one third residential and two thirds farmland, rivers and canals. New Sawley has a purpose built Government Rehabilitation Centre and Skill Training Centre on the Wilsthorpe Road which was erected in 1947 to retrain men leaving the armed forces after the Second World War, in construction trades such as engineering and welding. It is also a retraining establishment for the disabled and long term unemployed. The Skill Training Centre section is used to sell training to employers - to up-grade the skills of employees. This section will be closed in March 1986 and moved to the Beeston Skill Centre. Old Sawley Scouts and Old Age Pensioners havew their own headquarter
